properties.areaDesc: Southern Centre; Bedford; Blair; Northern Centre; Cambria; Mifflin; Huntingdon
properties.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 13 at 11:38PM EST by NWS State College PA
properties.description:
HAZARDS...A line of snow squalls accompanied by winds of 20 MPH
which can rapidly reduce visibility to less than one mile.

LOCATION AND MOVEMENT...At 1132 PM EST, a broken line of snow
squalls was from just northwest of State College, to just east of
Johnstown. The activity was moving east at 40 mph.

SQUALLs WILL BE NEAR...
State College around 1145 PM EST.
Houserville, Lemont and Boalsburg around 1155 PM EST.
Bellefonte, Pleasant Gap and Centre Hall around 1205 AM EST.
Zion and Spring Mills around 1210 AM EST.
Madisonburg around 1215 AM EST.
Rebersburg and Aaronsburg around 1220 AM EST.

This includes Interstate 99 from mile markers 15 to 85.

SAFETY INFO...
Use extra caution if you must travel into or through these squalls.
Rapid changes in visibility and potentially slick roads are likely to
lead to accidents. Consider delaying travel until this squall passes
your location.

Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be
prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra
time to reach your destination.

NWSheadline: A LINE OF SNOW SQUALLS WILL AFFECT PARTS OF BEDFORD...NORTHERN CENTRE... BLAIR...CAMBRIA...HUNTINGDON...MIFFLIN...AND SOUTHERN CENTRE COUNTIES
